step_by_step.explanation: Alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons containing only single C–C bonds with the general formula CnH2n+2.

problems.final_answer: Alkanes: saturated hydrocarbons, only single bonds, CnH2n+2.

problems.problem: Define cycloalkanes and give their general formula.

step_by_step.explanation: Cycloalkanes are saturated hydrocarbons arranged in a ring structure with the general formula CnH2n.

problems.problem: Draw the structural formula of cyclohexane.

step_by_step.explanation: A six-membered carbon ring with single bonds.

problems.final_answer: Structural formula: C6H12 (hexagon ring of single-bonded carbons).

problems.problem: Explain the difference between straight-chain and branched alkanes.

step_by_step.explanation: Carbon atoms connected in a continuous, unbranched chain.
Carbon chain has side branches attached to the main chain.

problems.final_answer: Straight-chain: continuous C chain; Branched-chain: side chains present.

problems.problem: Give the IUPAC name of CH3-CH2-CH2-CH3.

step_by_step.explanation: Three-carbon main chain with methyl branch on second carbon → 2-methylpropane

problems.problem: Explain the concept of isomerism in alkanes.

step_by_step.explanation: Alkanes with the same molecular formula but different structures (straight-chain vs branched) are structural isomers.

problems.final_answer: Alkane isomers: same formula, different connectivity (structural isomers).

problems.problem: Explain combustion of alkanes and write a general equation.

step_by_step.explanation: Alkanes react with O₂ to produce CO₂ and H₂O, releasing energy.

problems.final_answer: Complete combustion: CnH2n+2 + O2 → CO2 + H2O

problems.problem: Explain halogenation of alkanes under UV light.

step_by_step.explanation: Alkane + halogen (Cl2 or Br2) in presence of UV light undergoes substitution: H atom replaced by halogen atom.

problems.final_answer: Halogenation: UV light induces substitution of H by halogen.

problems.problem: Give the general formula for cycloalkanes and explain why it differs from alkanes.

step_by_step.explanation: CnH2n because two H atoms are lost to form the ring closure.

problems.final_answer: Cycloalkanes: CnH2n; fewer H atoms than alkanes due to ring formation.
